sen.j: 悪樓（あくる）は、日本神話に伝わる悪神。
sen.e: Akuru is an evil god in Japanese Methodology.
Akuru is an evil god in Japanese Methodology.

sen.j: 吉備国（岡山県）の穴海に住んでいた巨大魚。
sen.e: Akuru was a giant fish which used to live in the Anaumi Inland Sea in the Kibi Province (current Okayama Prefecture).
Akuru was a giant fish which used to live in the Anaumi Inland Sea in the Kibi Province (current Okayama Prefecture).

sen.j: その大きさは、近づく船をひと飲みにするほど。
sen.e: The size of the fish was huge enough to drink a nearby boat at one gulp.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』景行紀廿七年に表れる「惡神」「吉備穴濟神」、『古事記』景行天皇条に表れる「穴戸神」のことであるとする説がある。
sen.e: In one theory, akuru is regarded as the 'akujin' or 'Kibi no Ananowatari-no-kami' which appear in the 21st year in the Keiko-ki (records regarding the time of the Emperor Keiko) in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), or 'Anato-no-kami' which appear in the article regarding the Emperor Keiko in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters).

sen.j: ヤマトタケルが熊襲討伐後の帰り道にこの悪樓に遭った。
sen.e: On his way home from subjugation of kumaso (a tribe living in the ancient Kyushu district), Yamato Takeru met this akuru.
